alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Hoke; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 7:20PM EDT until June 17 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Wayne County in central North Carolina... Sampson County in central North Carolina... Southeastern Cumberland County in central North Carolina... Wilson County in central North Carolina... Southeastern Johnston County in central North Carolina... Southeastern Hoke County in central North Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 720 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wilson to 13 miles northwest of Mount Olive to near Fayetteville to near Antioch, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. There are widespread reports of trees and power lines down across this area. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Goldsboro, Clinton, Wilson, Mount Olive, Elm City, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Harrells and Antioch. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Hoke; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne; Wilson
